title.value: Challenges for impact evaluation of WHO’s normative output
title.justification: The title succinctly summarizes the paper's focus on the challenges faced in evaluating the impact of WHO’s normative work.
title.quote: Challenges for impact evaluation of WHO’s normative output

extractions.description: The paper discusses the challenges faced by the World Health Organization (WHO) in evaluating the impact of its normative activities, such as guidelines and regulations. It highlights the need for robust evaluation mechanisms and data strategies to assess normative impacts effectively.

type.justification: The paper discusses conceptual frameworks, challenges, and strategies for impact evaluation, rather than conducting empirical research or experiments.
type.quote: Evaluating the impact of WHO norms requires appropriate data to be collected and made available.

name.justification: The paper focuses on the evaluation of WHO's norms and policies, which is a core concern of public health policy.
name.quote: A clearer picture of the impact of the World Health Organization (WHO) normative work including guidelines, codes and regulations is needed.

name.justification: The paper specifically addresses issues related to evaluating the impact of WHO's normative outputs, a key aspect of impact evaluation.
name.quote: Yet, WHO acknowledges that normative work is often complex and assessing its impact may be more costly and challenging than conducting other types of evaluation.

name.justification: The paper emphasizes the need for improved data collection, usage, and openness to support impact evaluation.
name.quote: WHO must strengthen its data strategy in relation to gathering, usage and openness.
